Send a copy of this message to my address ({$address})
This is a multi-part message in MIME format.
An unknown database connection error has occurred.
This page requires frames. Click here for the non-frames version.
Send me a confirmation email including my username and password
This will appear as a hyperlinked URL at the bottom of the bio statement on the "About the presenter" pop-up and "Organizing team" page.
No reader comments have been posted.
Deleting this comment will also delete any replies to it. Are you sure you wish to do this?
Requests to the main site will be redirected to this conference. This may be useful if the site is hosting only a single conference, for example.
The name of the principal contact is required.
The email address of the principal contact is required.
You must enter a minimum password length of at least 4 characters.

To have the contents of all conferences hosted on this site indexed within a globally distributed system of research databases, register your site's URL with the Public Knowledge Project metadata harvester. This tool collects the metadata from each indexed item in this conference, enabling accurate and collective searching among the research sites that adhere to the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting.

Click here and enter {$siteUrl} under Site URL, and {$oaiUrl} under Base URL for OAI Archive.

Note that the OAI interface can be disabled for this site by editing the OCS system configuration. Future versions of OCS will allow the OAI interface to be enabled or disabled for individual conferences within the site.
Are you sure you want to expire all user sessions? All users who are currently logged into the system will be forced to log in again (yourself included).
Are you sure you want to clear the cache of compiled templates?
This will be the default language for the site and any hosted conferences.

Select all locales to support on the site. The selected locales will be available for use by all conferences hosted on the site, and also appear in a language select menu to appear on each site page (which can be overridden on conference-specific pages). If multiple locales are not selected, the language toggle menu will not appear and extended language settings will not be available to conferences.
In registering people (managers, editors, reviewers, etc.), working languages should be included in their User Profiles for the benefit of conference editors.
Are you sure you want to reload this locale? This will erase any existing locale-specific data such as customized email templates.
Are you sure you want to uninstall this locale? This may affect any hosted conferences currently using the locale.

Select any additional locales to install support for in this system. Locales must be installed before they can be used by hosted conferences. See the OCS documentation for information on adding support for new languages.
No additional locales are available for installation.
Are you sure you want to permanently delete this authentication source?
No authentication sources have been defined.

Enable user profile synchronization (if supported by this authentication plug-in). User profile information will be automatically updated from the remote source when a user logs in, and profile changes (including password changes) made within OCS will be automatically updated on the remote source. If this option is not enabled OCS profile information will be kept separate from remote source profile information.

Enable user password modification (if supported by this authentication plug-in). Enabling this option allows users to modify their password from within OCS and to use the OCS "lost password" feature to reset a forgotten password. These functions will be unavailable to users with this authentication source if this option is not enabled.

Enable user creation (if supported by this authentication plug-in). Users created within OCS with this authentication source will be automatically added to the remote authentication source if they do not already exist. Additionally, if this source is the default authentication source, OCS accounts created through user registration will also be added to the remote authentication source.

Specifying a default authentication source other than OCS has the following effects:
  • If a user attempts to register a new account with this site with a username that exists on the authentication source (but not in the OCS database), the registration attempt is only allowed if the supplied password is valid for that user account.
Basic operating system and server software versions. Click on Extended PHP Information to view extended details of this server's PHP configuration.

Use this form to modify your system configuration (the config.inc.php file). Click Save to save your new configuration, or "Display" to simply display the updated configuration file and not modify your existing configuration.

Warning: Modifying these settings can potentially leave your site in an inaccessible state (requiring your configuration file to be manually fixed). It is strongly recommended that you do not make any changes unless you know exactly what you are doing.
The configuration file <tt>config.inc.php</tt> does not exist, is not readable, or is invalid.

NOTE!

The system could not automatically overwrite the configuration file. To apply your configuration changes you must open config.inc.php in a suitable text editor and replace its contents with the contents of the text field below.

The contents of your updated configuration are displayed below. To apply the configuration changes you must open <tt>config.inc.php</tt> in a suitable text editor and replace its contents with the contents of the text field below.

Your configuration file has been successfully updated. Please note that if your site no longer functions correctly you may need to manually fix your configuration by editing <tt>config.inc.php</tt> directly.
Are you sure you want to permanently delete this conference and all of its contents?
You will automatically be enrolled as the director of this conference. After creating a new conference, enter it as a director to continue with its setup and user enrollment.
The path can contain only alphanumeric characters, underscores, and hyphens, and must begin and end with an alphanumeric character.
The selected path is already in use by another conference.
Enable this conference to appear publicly on the site
The conference description identifies the ongoing mission of this conference. It appears on the main conference page, as well as all of the conference's convention pages.
Enable this event to appear publicly on the site
Are you sure you want to permanently delete this scheduled conference and all of its contents?

A scheduled instance of the conference is created by entering a title (for example, if it is an annual conference, the name of the conference plus the year) and a URL path. You will be made a Conference Director and can designate other Conference Directors, who are able to manage the details of this event, beginning with the scheduling of the conference in Conference Timeline.
The selected path is already in use in this conference.

OCS calculates the following statistics for each event. The "days to review" is calculated from date of submission (or designation of Review Version) to the initial Editor Decision, while the "days to publish" is measured for accepted submissions from its original uploading to its publication.
Check items to be made available to readers in About the Conference.
Select the tracks for calculating this conference's peer-reviewed statistics.
Note: Percentages for peer reviewed submissions may not add up to 100%, as items resubmitted are either accepted, declined, or still in process.

OCS generates reports that track the details associated with processing submissions to the conference from the perspective of submissions, editors, reviewers, and tracks, over a given period of time. Reports are generated in CSV format which require a spreadsheet application to view.
This is a site-wide plugin. Only the Site Manager may manage this plugin.
Generic plugins are used to extend Open Conference Systems in a variety of ways that are not supported by the other plugin categories.
Authorization Plugins allow Open Conference Systems to delegate user authentication tasks to other systems, such as LDAP servers.
Import/Export Plugins can be used to transfer content to and from other systems.
Gateway Plugins provide live data to external systems.
No files were found in this directory.
Delete this file or directory? Note that a directory must be empty before it can be deleted.
Note: The Files Browser is an advanced feature that allows the files and directories associated with a conference to be viewed and manipulated directly.
Five Steps to a Conference Web Site
Conference title, introduction & overview, dates, contacts, sponsors & supporters, and location.
Guidelines, review policy, and privacy statement.
Access controls; presenter and participant self-registration; logging.
Homepage header, content, conference header, footer, navigation bar, and style sheet.
Your conference setup has been updated.

Almost Done!

A conference has now been set up, which may entail a single event, an annual conference, or a series of events, all of which can be managed from this conference site. In order to schedule a specific instance of this conference, go to Scheduled Conferences. You may access this page at any time via the Conference Manager's homepage.

You can return to these five pages at any time by following the links to "User Home > Conference Director > Setup".

You can manage events through "User Home > Event Director > Setup"
If using HTML in Setup text boxes (for font size, bold, color, etc.), note that "returns" in the text are automatically treated as <tt><br></tt>.

Conferences are set up in two stages. The first stage is concerned with the conference in general, whether it is held only once, run annually, or run as a series. The second set of steps, which are completed after these initial steps are in place, concerns the specific and scheduled instances of the conference. This permits a website to be run for the conference in general, with many instances of it available to readers (e.g., My Conference, with My Conference 2007; My Conference 2008, etc.) Conference Managers set up the general conference site, while Conference Directors set up the scheduled instances of the conference.
An introduction provides participants with a concise synopsis of the conference. Typically, introductions do not exceed 100 words. The introduction is used when a longer overview is not appropriate.
An overview details the whole of the conference. It includes such items as direction, topics, and structure.

This position, which can be treated as a principal editorship, managing editorship, or administrative staff position, will be listed on the homepage of the conference under Contact, along with the Technical Support Contact.

This person will be listed on the conference's Contact page for the use of presenters and reviewers, and should have experience working through the system from the perspective of all of its roles. As this conference system requires very little technical support, this should be seen as a part-time assignment. There may be occasions, for example, when presenters and reviewers have difficulties with the instructions or file formats, or there's a need to ensure that the conference is regularly backed up on the server.
Any undeliverable emails will result in an error message to this address.

Note: To activate this option, the site administrator must enable the allow_envelope_sender option in the OCS configuration file. Additional server configuration may be required to support this functionality (which may not be possible on all servers), as indicated in the OCS documentation.

The prepared emails that are sent by the system on behalf of the conference will have the following signature added to the end. The body of the prepared emails are available for editing under Conference Management.
To assist the users of search engines in discovering this conference, provide a brief description of the conference and relevant keywords (separated by semicolons).
Custom HTML header tags to be inserted in the header of every page (e.g., META tags).
The primary contact name is required.
The primary contact email is required.

Outline the conference's review policy and processes for readers and presenters, including the number of reviewers typically used in reviewing a submission, the criteria by which reviewers are asked to judge submissions, typical time taken to conduct the reviews, and the principles for recruiting reviewers. This will appear in About the Conference.

The Review Guidelines provide reviewers with criteria for judging a submission's suitability for acceptance to the conference, as well as any special instructions for preparing an effective and helpful review.
This statement will appear in About the Conference, as well as on the Presenter Submission and Notification sign-up pages. Below is a recommended privacy policy, which can be revised at any point.
Add Item to Appear in "About the Conference"

Open Conference Systems supports the LOCKSS (Lots of Copies Keep Stuff Safe) system to ensure a secure and permanent archive for the conference. LOCKSS is open source software developed at Stanford University Library that enables libraries to preserve selected web conferences by regularly polling registered conference websites for newly published content and archiving it. Each archive is continually validated against other library caches, and if content is found to be corrupted or lost, the other caches or the conference is used to restore it.

Setting up LOCKSS support for Open Conference Systems does not need to take place until after publishing is fully underway, at which point follow these two steps:

Identify 6-10 libraries that will register and cache the conference. For example, turn to institutions where editors or Board members work and/or institutions already participating in LOCKSS. See participating libraries. Use the prepared invitations for (i) libraries participating in LOCKSS or (ii) libraries not yet participating in LOCKSS.
Enable LOCKSS to store and distribute conference content at participating libraries via a LOCKSS Publisher Manifest page. A LOCKSS license will appear in About the Conference under Archiving:
See other versions of a LOCKSS license.

OCS provides a number of security-related options that can be used to restrict access to the conference's contents (including the contents of past conferences), and maintain additional information about submissions for auditing purposes. In addition, Conference Directors are able to control access to active instances of scheduled conferences in Scheduled Conference Setup.
Allow users to register with the conference site as:
Disable user registration. Users will have to be manually created by a conference director.
Unregistered users can view the conference site.
Users must log in to view the conference site.
Unregistered users can view all posted abstracts and presentations associated with this conference.
Users must log in to view posted materials associated with this conference.
Reader comments on conference abstracts and presentations are disabled.
Registered users can post; anonymous posting is disabled.
Users can post anonymously, but must be registered.
Enable submission event logging, which maintains a log of all actions on a submission (accessible via each submission's "History" page).
Enable submission email logging, which maintains a log of all emails sent out related to a submission (accessible via each submission's "History" page).
Enable conference event logging, which maintains a log of automated actions effecting the conference or its events.
For Presenters to Index Their Work

OCS adheres to the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting, which is the emerging standard for providing well-indexed access to electronic research resources on a global scale. The presenters will use a similar template to provide metadata for their submission. The Conference Director should select the categories for indexing and present presenters with relevant examples to assist them in indexing their work, separating terms with a semi-colon (e.g., term1; term2). The entries should be introduced as examples by using "E.g.," or "For example,".
Useful when conference crosses disciplinary boundaries and/or presenters submit multidisciplinary items.
Provide examples of relevant academic disciplines for this conference
(E.g., History; Education; Sociology; Psychology; Cultural Studies; Law)

[Conference will use a subject classification system available on the web.
Title of classification system
(E.g., Mathematics Subject Classification; Library of Congress Classification)
Provide examples of keywords or topics as a guide for presenters
(E.g., Photosynthesis; Black Holes; Four-Color Map Problem; Bayesian Theory)
Refers to geo-spatial location, chronological or historical coverage, and/or characteristics of research sample.
Provide examples of relevant geo-spatial or geographical terms for this field
(E.g., Iberian Peninsula; Stratosphere; Boreal Forest; etc.)
Provide examples of relevant chronological or historical terms for this field
(E.g., European Renaissance; Jurassic Period; Third Trimester; etc.)
Provide examples of research sample characteristics for this field
Provide examples of relevant research types, methods, and approaches for this field
(E.g., Historical Inquiry; Quasi-Experimental; Literary Analysis; Survey/Interview)

To have the contents of this conference indexed within a globally distributed system of research databases, register your conference's URL with the Public Knowledge Project metadata harvester. This tool collects the metadata from each indexed item in this conference, enabling accurate and collective searching among the research sites that adhere to the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting.

Note that if your site administrator has already registered this site with the PKP Harvester, your conference will be indexed automatically and you do not need to register your conference.

Click here and enter {$siteUrl} under Site URL, and {$oaiUrl} under Base URL for OAI Archive.
Papers can be tagged with an identification number or string, if the conference is using an item registration system such as the Digital Object Identifier System (DOI).
Custom identifiers will be used to identify posted papers.
Custom identifiers will be used to identify supplemental files submitted with papers.
Provide open access to the conference's contents as each issue or item is published.
Open Access Policy (to appear in About the Conference)
Restrict access to the conference's contents to registrants.
The Registration Management module is operated by the Registration Director and includes additional open access, self-archiving, and email notification options.
If subscription management has been enabled, this person will be listed on the conference's About page as the primary contact for subscriptions.
Announcements may be published to inform readers of conference news and events. Published announcements will appear on the Announcements page.
Enable Conference Directors to add conference announcements.
of the most recent announcements on the conference homepage.
Enter any additional information that should be displayed to readers on the Announcements page.
A graphic version of the conference's title and logo (as a .gif, .jpg, or .png file) can be uploaded for the homepage, which will replace the text version that otherwise appears.
Enter the maximum number of items (for example, submissions, users, or editing assignments) that appear on each page of a list, and the number of pages links to display on each page.
Navigation bar items can be added to the current set (Home, About, User Home, etc.) that appear at the top of the page.

A graphic version of the conference's title and logo (.gif, .jpg, or .png file), possibly a smaller version of the one used on the homepage, can be uploaded to appear as a header on conference pages, which will replace the text version that otherwise appears.
Alternately, instead of title and logo, an HTML version of the header can be inserted into the text box below. Leave textbox blank if not required.

This is the footer of your conference. To change or update the footer, paste the HTML code in the textbox below. Examples could be another navigation bar, a counter, etc. This footer will appear on every page.

By default conferences and the site use a common style sheet (located in the "styles" subdirectory of the site). The default style rules can be overridden by uploading a conference-specific cascading style sheet.
By default, the homepage consists of navigation links. Additional homepage content can be appended by using one or all of the following options, which will appear in the order shown.
Add an image or graphic file to the middle of the page.
Add the following content, using text/HTML, which will appear below the homepage image, if one is uploaded.
Add or remove additional navigation bar items.
The label value is a literal string (e.g., "Conference Setup") rather than a localization message key (e.g., "director.setup")
URL is an absolute URL (e.g., "http://www.example.com") rather than a path relative to the site (e.g., "/director/setup")
Invalid homepage header title image format. Accepted formats are .gif, .jpg, or .png.
Invalid homepage header logo image format. Accepted formats are .gif, .jpg, or .png.
Invalid page header title image format. Accepted formats are .gif, .jpg, or .png.
Invalid page header logo image format. Accepted formats are .gif, .jpg, or .png.
Invalid alternate homepage header title image format. Accepted formats are .gif, .jpg, or .png.
Invalid alternate homepage header logo image format. Accepted formats are .gif, .jpg, or .png.
Invalid alternate page header title image format. Accepted formats are .gif, .jpg, or .png.
Invalid alternate page header logo image format. Accepted formats are .gif, .jpg, or .png.
Invalid second alternate homepage header title image format. Accepted formats are .gif, .jpg, or .png.
Invalid second alternate homepage header logo image format. Accepted formats are .gif, .jpg, or .png.
Invalid second alternate page header title image format. Accepted formats are .gif, .jpg, or .png.
Invalid second alternate page header logo image format. Accepted formats are .gif, .jpg, or .png.
Invalid homepage image format. Accepted formats are .gif, .jpg, or .png.
Invalid conference stylesheet format. Accepted format is .css.
Brief descriptions of the conference for prospective presenters and readers are available in the "Information" section of the sidebar.

These steps are designed to set up a specific instance of the conference. Once a conference is set up in this way, the setup content will be copied to the next instance of the conference as the default setup that can be edited by the current conference directors.
The location (institution, department, and mailing address) at which the conference will be held.
Conference title, introduction & overview, contacts, and sponsors.
Presenter registration, submissions, and presenter notification.
Homepage header, content, conference header, footer, navigation bar, and style sheet.
An introduction provides participants with a concise synopsis of the event. Typically, introductions do not exceed 100 words. The introduction is used when a longer overview is not appropriate.
An overview details the whole of the event. It includes such items as direction, topics, and structure.
The first day of conference activities.
The final day of conference activities.
Lay out the program by date, time, location, and event. Update this information as you begin to finalize your list of presenters and presentation titles.

The name of the organizations (e.g., scholarly associations, university departments, cooperatives, etc.) sponsoring the conference will appear on the conference homepage and may be accompanied by a note of acknowledgement.
Additional agencies or organizations that provide financial or in-kind support for the conference will appear on the conference homepage and may be accompanied by a note of acknowledgement.
This information is displayed in the "call-for-papers" link on this conference's home page.
Open presenter self-registration (set dates in Conference Timeline)
Conference submissions may consist of several items: an abstract, and perhaps a paper and supplemental materials. In this section, the items to be collected as parts of a submission are specified.
Accept supplementary materials to accompany the submission during review
Accept supplementary materials to accompany the submission when published
Submissions must be completed by certain deadlines. If desired, a few days before these deadlines, presenters may be sent a warning e-mail (which can be viewed and edited in Prepared Emails).
Remind presenters with incomplete submissions before their submission deadline passes.
Time before deadline that reminders are sent
Note: The submission deadline warning email is currently disabled. To use this feature, enable the SUBMISSION_DEADLINE_WARN email in Prepared Emails.
Subject papers to peer review after the abstracts have been reviewed and accepted
Abstracts and papers will be collected and reviewed at the same time.
Papers will be collected only after abstracts are reviewed.
The typical period of time allowed for reviews
Can be modified during the review process.
Automated email reminders (available in OCS's Prepared Emails) can be sent to reviewers at two points (while the editor can always email the reviewer directly as well)
If reviewer has not responded to a review request within
If reviewer has not submitted a recommendation within
The editor will rate reviewers on a five-point quality scale after each review. The ratings will be available to Conference Directors for future conferences.
Reviewers will have access to the submission file only after agreeing to review it.

Note: The email invitation to reviewers will contain a special URL that takes invited reviewers directly to the Review page for the submission (with access to any other pages requiring them to log in). For security reasons with this option, editors are not able to modify email addresses or add CCs or BCCs prior to sending invitations to reviewers.

Set out for presenters the bibliographic and formatting standards used for items submitted to the conference (e.g., Publication Manual of the American Psychological Association, 5th edition, 2001). It is often helpful to provide examples of the common citation formats for journals and books to be used in submissions. Also identify the types of appropriate Supplementary Files (e.g., data-sets, research instruments, etc.) which presenters should be encouraged to upload, in addition to their submission, to enhance readers' engagement with their work.

On making a submission to the conference, presenters are first asked to check each item on the Submission Preparation Checklist as completed, before proceeding. The checklist also appears in the Presenter Guidelines, under About the Conference. The list can be edited below, but all items on the list will require a checkmark before presenters can proceed with their submission.

This Copyright Notice will appear in About the Conference and in each published item's metadata. Presenters can retain copyright, while granting the conference right of first publication. Alternatively, presenters can transfer copyright to the conference, which then permits presenters non-commercial use of the work, including the right to place it in an open access archive. In addition, Creative Commons can be consulted for flexible copyright licenses.
Require presenters to agree to Copyright Notice as part of the submission process.

On completing the submission process, presenters are automatically sent an acknowledgement email (which can be viewed and edited in Prepared Emails). In addition, a copy of the acknowledgement email can be sent as follows:
Send a copy to the conference's primary contact, identified in Setup Step 1.
Send a copy to this email address:
Note: The submission acknowledgement email is currently disabled. To use this feature, enable the SUBMISSION_ACK email in Prepared Emails.
Times are specified in the default time zone, "{$defaultTimeZone}", where it is currently {$currentTimeInDefaultTimeZone}. Where times are unspecified, midnight is assumed.
The following dates determine deadlines for contributors to this conference.
The following dates determine when papers are released to conference stakeholders.
Submissions released to registered users on
Submissions released to the public on

If desired, OCS may permit users to register themselves as reviewers for this event. If these options are disabled, the Event Director must manually register users as reviewers via the Event Management pages.
Permit users to register as reviewers starting on
Visitors to the conference website have open access to the conference's abstracts and presentations (see Website Posting for dates).
Require website registration as Reader at no charge (see Security/Access).
Conference registrants alone have access to abstracts and presentations.

The Conference Manager can activate Registration Management, which is to be set up and managed by the registered Registration Manager. The contact information for this user should be listed below and will appear in the conference's About the Conference page as the primary contact for registration.
Layout the program by date, time, location, and event. Update this information as you begin to finalize your list of presenters and presentation titles.
If the program is available as a file, you may upload it here.

Enter a text-based version of your conference program here. Even if a program file is provided above, a text-based program is recomended since it allows easier indexing by search engines and can be viewed without browser plug-ins.

If these settings are left unconfigured, this event will default to the look and feel of the conference it belongs to. In order to change the look and feel of the entire conference, the Conference Manager must modify the Conference Setup pages.

The scheduled conference's homepage includes by default the conference's name, dates, location, and introduction, and main topics with links (Overview; Call for Papers; Featured Speakers; Program and Presentations; Registration, Accomodation and Travel; Conference Organizers and Key Partners; Related Links).

OCS can be made available to users in any of several supported languages. As well, OCS can operate as a partially multilingual system, providing users with an ability to toggle between languages on each page, and allowing certain data to be entered in up to two additional languages.

If a language supported by OCS is not listed below, ask your site administrator to install the language from the site administration interface. For instructions on adding support for new languages, please consult the OCS documentation.
This will be the default language for the conference site.
Select all locales to support on the site via a language select menu to appear on each page. The menu will only appear if more than one locale is selected.
Sorry, no additional languages are available. Contact your site administrator if you wish to use additional languages with this conference.
Are you sure you want to permanently delete this track?
A title is required for the track.
An abbreviated title is required for the track
Select from among the available Track Editors and "Assign Editor" to this track.
Submissions made to this conference track
Will not be included in the proceedings of the conference
Items can only be submitted by Editors and Track Editors.
Omit this track from About the Conference.
In their metadata, identify items in this track as
Items published in this track will not have abstracts.
Enter the dates when acivities are to take place for this scheduled conference, and then notify the relevant users with the prepared email at the indicated dates.
Are you sure you wish to delete this group?
No organizing team positions have been created.
For the Organizing Team in About the Conference:
The Conference Director will create organizing team titles, and add the appropriate people under each title.
The system will generate a list of people under their assigned roles (Conference Director, Reviewer, etc.)
Are you sure you wish to delete this group membership?
Remove this user from this conference? This action will unenroll the user from all roles within this conference.

Disable this user? This will prevent the user from logging into the system.
You may optionally provide the user with a reason for disabling their account.
If no roles are selected, the user will be created in the system but not be enrolled in any role within this conference. Roles can be assigned or unassigned at any point after the user is created.
Sorry, the requested user does not exist.

Sorry, you do not have administrative rights over this user. This may be because:
  • The user is a site administrator
  • The user is active in conferences you do not manage
This task must be performed by a site administrator.
Send the user a welcome email containing their username and password.
Require the user to change their password the next time they log in.
Select the users you would like to email by checking the boxes beside their names
An email with the given key already exists. Email keys must be unique.
Are you sure you want to delete this email template?
Are you sure you want to reset this email template to its default values?
Are you sure you want to reset all email templates in this conference? You will lose any customizations you have made.
A subject is required for the email.
A body is required for the email.
The contact listed under Registrations in About the Conference.

The Registration Types and fee structure will be automatically placed under Registrations on the About the Conference page, along with the name and contact information for the Registration Manager. Additional information about registrations, such as methods of payment or support for subscribers in developing countries, can be added here.
HTML can be used in textarea (for font size, color, etc.), with "returns" treated as <tt><br></tt>; HTML editor works with Firefox browsers.
Warning! All registrations with this registration type will also be deleted. Are you sure you want to continue and delete this registration type?
No registration types have been created.
A registration type name is required.
A registration type with this name already exists.
The cost must be a positive, numeric value.
A registration access type is required.
Please select a valid registration access type.
Enter a numeric value (e.g. 40 or 40.00). Do not include any other text such as "$".
The date on which users are permitted to register themselves using this registration type.
The deadline for registrations of this type.
Site access for this registration type ends on this date.
Subscribers should be validated via domain or IP authentication.
Subscribers must be members of an association or organization.
This registration type will not appear under Registrations in About the Conference.
Registration access privileges are automatically granted to the conference's Conference Directors, Editors, and Track Editors.
Are you sure you want to delete this registration?
This user already has a registration for this conference.
Please select a valid registration type.
The selected registration type requires membership information.
The selected registration type requires a domain and/or an IP range for registration authentication.
Please enter a valid IP range.
In order to send the user a notification email, the registration contact name and email address must be specified in the Conference Setup.
Enter membership information if the registration type requires that subscribers belong to an association or organization.
Enter a domain if the registration type is for institutions. If a domain is entered here, the IP range is optional. Valid values are domain names (e.g. lib.sfu.ca).

Enter an IP range if the registration type is for institutions. If an IP range is entered here, the domain is optional. Valid values include an IP (e.g. 142.58.103.1), a CIDR IP range (e.g. 142.58.100.0/24), an IP range (e.g. 142.58.103.1 - 142.58.103.4), an IP range with '*' (e.g. 142.58.103.*), or any combination of these separated by a ';' (e.g. 142.58.103.* - 142.58.107.* ; 142.58.108.1/24 ; 142.58.106.*)
Please use this space to include any special requests or requirements for this registration (e.g. dietary restrictions, or disabilities.)
Send the user an email with their username and registration details.
An announcement type name is required.
An announcement type with this name already exists.
Warning! All announcements with this announcement type will also be deleted. Are you sure you want to continue and delete this announcement type?
No announcement types have been created.
Are you sure you want to permanently delete this announcement?
A brief description to appear along with the announcement title.
The full text of the announcement.
The announcement will be displayed to readers until this date. Leave blank if the announcement should be displayed indefinitely.
Please select a valid announcement type.
A short announcement description is required.
Please select a valid announcement expiry date.
Please select a month and/or day in addition to the expiry date year.

Presenters submit items to this conference through this web site in a multi-step process for uploading the relevant information (some conferences allow the presenter to upload, as well, supplementary files, such as research data and instruments). If difficulties are encountered in this process, contact {$supportName} by email or phone {$supportPhone} for assistance.
Select the appropriate track for this submission (see Track Policies in About the Conference).
Indicate that this submission is ready to be considered by this conference by checking off the following (comments to the editor can be added below).
You must make sure all items in the submission checklist are satisfied before continuing.
The presenters agree to the terms of this Copyright Notice, which will apply to this submission if and when it is published by this conference (comments to the editor can be added below).
You must agreee to the terms of the Copyright Notice before continuing.
Please select an appropriate conference track for this submission.
Please enter an abstract for your submission.

This conference gathers metadata about each submission, according to the standards set by the Open Archives Initiative, which is the emerging online standard for identifying research resources. This enables collective and accurate searching across OAI databases, increasing the likelihood that readers will find submissions such as this one. Editors may insist that metadata be provided before initiating the editorial process.
For submissions with more than one presenter, order presenters as they are to appear on citation.
Use arrows to change the order in which the presenters' names are to appear with the submission.
Choose terms that best describe the submission's content following the categories used by this conference, and examples provided by the editor. Separate terms with a semi-colon (term1; term2; term3).
Identify agencies that provided funding or support for the work presented in this submission.
Use the hyperlinked classification system to select classification terms and, if appropriate, numbers.
At least one presenter is required.
The first name, last name, and email address of each presenter is required.
Please enter the title of your paper.

To upload a paper to this conference, complete the following steps.
  1. On this page, click Browse (or Choose File) which opens a Choose File window for locating the file on the hard drive of your computer.
  2. Locate the file you wish to submit and highlight it.
  3. Click Open on the Choose File window, which places the name of the file on this page.
  4. Click Upload on this page, which uploads the file from the computer to the conference's web site and renames it following the conference's conventions.
  5. Once the submission is uploaded, click Save and Continue at the bottom of this page.
The file can be viewed by clicking on the file name. A new or revised file can be uploaded, deleting the one that currently appears. Additional files can be added using Supplementary Files (next step). If you have difficulties uploading the submission, contact {$supportName} by email or phone {$supportPhone} for assistance.
Are you sure you wish to continue without uploading a submission file?

This optional step in the submission process allows presenters to add files to the submission which improve the contribution which the submission makes. Supplementary Files might include (a) research instruments, (b) data sets, which comply with the terms of the study's research ethics review, (c) sources that otherwise would be unavailable to readers, or (d) figures or tables that cannot be integrated into the text itself. These files are also indexed by the presenter, identifying their relation to the submission, as well as their ownership. Supplementary Files can be uploaded in any file format and will be made available to readers in their original format. They can be shared with peer reviewers, if they do not compromise the blind review.
No supplementary files have been added to this submission.

To index this supplementary material, provide the following metadata for the uploaded supplementary file.
Present file to reviewers (without metadata), as it will not compromise blind review.

You must enter at least one search keyword.

Search tips:
  • Search terms are case-insensitive
  • Common words are ignored
  • By default only articles containing all terms in the query are returned (i.e., AND is implied)
  • Combine multiple words with OR to find articles containing either term; e.g., education OR research
  • Use parentheses to create more complex queries; e.g., archive ((journal OR conference) NOT theses)
  • Search for an exact phrase by putting it in quotes; e.g., "open access publishing"
  • Exclude a word by prefixing it with - or NOT; e.g. online -politics or online NOT politics
  • Use * in a term as a wildcard to match any sequence of characters; e.g., soci* morality would match documents containing "sociological" or "societal"

The PDF file you selected should load here, if your Web browser has a PDF reader plug-in installed (for example, a recent version of Adobe Acrobat Reader). This conference uses Open Conference Systems {$ocsVersion}, which is open source conference management and publishing software developed, supported, and freely distributed by the Public Knowledge Project under the GNU General Public License.

This site uses Open Conference Systems {$ocsVersion}, which is open source conference management and publishing software developed, supported, and freely distributed by the Public Knowledge Project under the GNU General Public License.
No matching help topics were found.

OCS Version {$version}

Thank you for downloading the Public Knowledge Project's Open Conference Systems. Before proceeding, please read the README file included with this software. For more information about the Public Knowledge Project and its software projects, please visit the PKP web site. If you have bug reports or technical support inquiries about Open Conference Systems, see the support forum or visit PKP's online bug reporting system. Although the support forum is the preferred method of contact, you can also email the team at pkp-support@sfu.ca.

Upgrade

If you are upgrading an existing installation of OCS 2.x, click here to proceed.

Recommended system requirements

  • PHP >= 4.2.x (including PHP 5.x)
  • MySQL >= 3.23.23 (including MySQL 4.x) or PostgreSQL >= 7.1 (including PostgreSQL 8.x)
  • Apache >= 1.3.2x or >= 2.0.4x or Microsoft IIS 6
  • Operating system: Any OS that supports the above software, including Linux, BSD, Solaris, Mac OS X, Windows

As PKP does not have the resources to test every possible combination of software versions and platforms, no guarantee of correct operation or support is implied.

Changes to these settings can be made after installation by editing the file config.inc.php in the base OCS directory, or using the site administration web interface.

Supported database systems

OCS has currently only been tested on MySQL and PostgreSQL, although other database management systems supported by ADOdb may work (in full or partially). Compatibility reports and/or code patches for alternative DBMSs can be sent to the OCS team.

Pre-Installation Steps

1. The following files and directories (and their contents) must be made writable:

  • config.inc.php is writable (optional): {$writable_config}
  • public/ is writable: {$writable_public}
  • cache/ is writable: {$writable_cache}
  • cache/t_cache/ is writable: {$writable_templates_cache}
  • cache/t_compile/ is writable: {$writable_templates_compile}
  • cache/_db is writable: {$writable_db_cache}

2. A directory to store uploaded files must be created and made writable (see "File Settings" below).

Manual installation

Select Manual Install to display the SQL statements necessary to create the OCS database schema and initial data so that database installation can be performed manually. This option is useful when debugging installation problems, particularly on unsupported platforms. Note that this installation method will not attempt to create the database or any tables, although the configuration file will still be written with the supplied database settings.

OCS Version {$version}

Thank you for downloading the Public Knowledge Project's Open Conference Systems. Before proceeding, please read the README and UPGRADE files included with this software. For more information about the Public Knowledge Project and its software projects, please visit the PKP web site. If you have bug reports or technical support inquiries about Open Conference Systems, see the support forum or visit PKP's online bug reporting system. Although the support forum is the preferred method of contact, you can also email the team at pkp-support@sfu.ca.

It is strongly recommended that you back up your database, files directory, and OCS installation directory before proceeding.

If you are running in PHP Safe Mode, please ensure that the max_execution_time directive in your php.ini configuration file is set to a high limit. If this or any other time limit (e.g. Apache's "Timeout" directive) is reached and the upgrade process is interrupted, manual intervention will be required.

For complete Unicode (UTF-8) support, select UTF-8 for all character set settings. Note that this support currently requires a MySQL >= 4.1.1 or PostgreSQL >= 7.1 database server. Please also note that full Unicode support requires PHP >= 4.3.0 compiled with support for the mbstring library (enabled by default in most recent PHP installations). You may experience problems using extended character sets if your server does not meet these requirements.

Your server currently supports mbstring: {$supportsMBString}
The primary language to use for this system. Please consult the OCS documentation if you are interested in support for languages not listed here.

Select any additional languages to support in this system. These languages will be available for use by conferences hosted on the site. Additional languages can also be installed at any time from the site administration interface.
The encoding to use for data sent to and received from browsers.

The encoding to use for data sent to and received from the database. This should be the same as the client character set. Note that this capability is only supported with MySQL >= 4.1.1 or PostgreSQL >= 7.1. Select "Not available" if your database server does not meet these requirements.

The encoding to use for data stored in the database. Note that this capability is only supported with MySQL >= 4.1.1 or PostgreSQL >= 7.1. Select "Not available" if your database server does not meet these requirements.

Enter full pathname to an existing directory where uploaded files are to be kept. This directory should not be directly web-accessible. Please ensure that this directory exists and is writable prior to installation. Windows path names should use forward slashes, e.g. "C:/myconference/files".
SHA1 is recommended if your system supports it (requires PHP >= 4.3.0).
This user account will become the site administrator and have complete access to the system. Additional user accounts can be created after installation.

OCS requires access to a SQL database to store its data. See the system requirements above for a list of supported databases. In the fields below, provide the settings to be used to connect to the database.

Database drivers listed in brackets do not appear to have the required PHP extension loaded and installation will likely fail if selected.
Any unsupported database drivers listed above are listed solely for academic purposes and are unlikely to work.

Leave the hostname blank to connect using domain sockets instead of over TCP/IP. This is not necessary with MySQL, which will automatically use sockets if "localhost" is entered, but is required with some other database servers such as PostgreSQL.

To use this option your database system must support remote database creation and your user account must have the appropriate permissions to create new databases. If installation fails with this option selected, manually create the database on your server and run the installer again with this option disabled.
A unique identifier used to identify metadata records indexed from this site using the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting.
A client character set must be selected.
The directory to be used for storing uploaded files is required.
The algorithm to use for encrypting user passwords must be selected.
A database driver must be selected.
A username for the administrator account is required.
A password for the administrator account is required.
The administrator username can contain only alphanumeric characters, underscores, and hyphens, and must begin and end with an alphanumeric character.
The administrator passwords do not match.
A valid email address for the administrator account is required.
The directory specified for uploaded files does not exist or is not writable.
The public files directory does not exist or is not writable.

IMPORTANT!

The installer could not automatically overwrite the configuration file. Before attempting to use the system, please open config.inc.php in a suitable text editor and replace its contents with the contents of the text field below.

Manual installation

The SQL statements to create the OCS database schema and initial data are displayed below. Note that the system will be unusable until these statements have been executed manually. You will also have to manually configure the config.inc.php configuration file.

Installation of OCS has completed successfully.

To begin using the system, login with the username and password entered on the previous page.

To enable Reading Tools, select options and choose field for related items, enter Settings.

The reading tools appear in a frame beside published items in the sections of the conference that have been designated for indexing. The reading tools consist of a set of optional tools related to the published item, listed below, and a set of tools that provide access to related items, organized by field and discipline.
Enable Reading Tools for designated sections of conference.
How to cite item (provides bibliographic detail for item).
Indexing metadata (displays item's indexing metadata provided by presenter and system).
Supplementary files (displays list of files presenter included with submission).
Print version (Leads to a printer-friendly version of an item).
About the presenter (displays the bio statements entered by the presenter).
Look up terms (enables readers to double-click on any word in an item and send the word to a dictionary).
Add comment (enables readers to post comments, which Conference Directors can delete. Reader Comments must be enabled in Setup, step 2).
Email the presenter (leads to an email template with presenter's email).
Notify a colleague (leads to an email template with link to item).
Are you sure you wish to irreversibly restore all versions to their defaults? If so, you will need to choose an active Version on the Settings page.
Are you sure you wish to delete this Version and all associated Contexts and Searches?
Are you sure you wish to delete this Context and all associated Searches?
Use presenter names as default search terms and describe the context as a search for citations to the article.
Use presenter names as default search terms to enable users to find other works by the presenters for this item (e.g., for an "Other Works" context)
Use geographical indexing data as default search terms.

Use the word highlighted by the reader as default search term or be left blank if none has been selected for this item (e.g., for a "Definition of terms" context). The "Definition of terms" option must be enabled in the RST Settings to allow double-clicking on words to open this context.
Are you sure you wish to delete this Search?

Possibly invalid URLs for search sites are displayed below.
You should manually verify any URLs marked as invalid, as this test is not 100% accurate.
Validation may fail on search URLs that require posted form data.
Geo-spatial location, chronological period, research sample (gender, age, etc.)

The search terms have been selected by the presenter(s). They can be altered or deleted by the reader, as two or three short, precise terms or phrases produced the best Boolean (AND) searches. To learn more about the resources searched, click on ABOUT. These resources have been selected for their relevance and open (free) access to all or part of their contents.

If the item is a HTML file (rather than a PDF), double clicking on any word in the text will make it appear in the Word-to-Define box. Otherwise, words can be typed or pasted in the box. To learn more about the resource searched, click on ABOUT. These resources have been selected because of their relevance and their open (free) access to all or part of their contents.

For items with more than one presenter, leave all names checked to search for similarly co-presented work, or search one at a time by checking only a single name. To learn more about the resource searched, click on ABOUT. These resources have been selected because of their relevance and their open (free) access to all or part of their contents.

If the article is indexed in Google Scholar, it may be accompanied by a "Cited by X" link, which leads to a list of works that cite it. As well, Google Scholar will list all items quoting the title and presenter. To access online resources that are only available through your research library, you may be able to go to Scholar Preferences in Google Scholar and activate the Library Links for your institution.
The submission has not been previously published, nor is it before another conference for consideration (or an explanation has been provided in Comments to the Editor).
The submission file is in Microsoft Word, RTF, or WordPerfect document file format.
All URL addresses in the text (e.g., http://pkp.sfu.ca) are activated and ready to click.

The text is single-spaced; uses a 12-point font; employs italics, rather than underlining (except with URL addresses); and all illustrations, figures, and tables are placed within the text at the appropriate points, rather than at the end.
The text adheres to the stylistic and bibliographic requirements outlined in the Presenter Guidelines, which is found in About the Conference.

If submitting to a peer-reviewed section of the conference, presenters' names are removed from submission, with "Presenter" and year used in the bibliography and footnotes, instead of presenters' name, paper title, etc.

If submitting to peer review, all Microsoft Office documents (including Supplementary Files) have been saved by going to File and selecting Save As; clicking Tools (or Options in a Mac); clicking Security; selecting "Remove personal information from file properties on save"; clicking Save.

The names and email addresses entered in this conference site will be used exclusively for the stated purposes of this conference and will not be made available for any other purpose or to any other party.
This conference provides immediate open access to its content on the principle that making research freely available to the public supports a greater global exchange of knowledge.

Presenters are permitted to post their articles on personal or institutional websites prior to and after publication by this conference (while providing the bibliographic details of that publication).

We encourage readers to sign up for notification of papers posted for this conference. We recommend that you review the About the Conference page for the conference's policies, and visit the Conference Homepage to find out what conferences are coming up.

Interested in submitting to this conference? We recommend that you review the About the Conference page for the conference's policies, and visit the Conference Homepage to find out what conferences are coming up.

This conference utilizes the LOCKSS system to create a distributed archiving system among participating libraries and permits those libraries to create permanent archives of the conference for purposes of preservation and restoration. More...

We encourage readers to sign up for notification of papers posted for this conference. Use the Register link at the top of the homepage for the conference. This list allows the conference to claim a certain level of support or readership. See the conference's Privacy Statement which assures readers that their name and email address will not be used for other purposes.

Interested in submitting to this conference? We recommend that you review the About the Conference page for the conference's track policies, as well as the Presenter Guidelines. Presenters need to register with the conference prior to submitting, or if already registered can simply log in and begin the submission process.
